org.programus.nxj.rockboy.core.mc
Class McAngle

java.lang.Object
  org.programus.nxj.rockboy.core.mc.McObject
      org.programus.nxj.rockboy.core.mc.McAngle

public class McAngle
extends McObject

Multi-Coordinate angle.

The angle values of two coordinates are opposite to each other, since the positive direction of y-axis are different.

You can retrieve a value in angle or radian. The data stored in class is in radian.

Author:
Programus
See Also:
org.programus.nxj.rockboy.core.mc

getRawRadian

public double getRawRadian()
Return the internal stored radian value. It is the value in LCD coordinate or nature coordinate according to the staticInLcd property.

Returns:

getRawAngle

public double getRawAngle()
Return the angle value of the internal stored radian.

Returns:

isStaticInLcd

public boolean isStaticInLcd()
Tell you whether this angle is static in LCD coordinate. Being static in LCD coordinate means the internal stored radian is the radian in LCD coordinate.

Specified by:
isStaticInLcd in class McObject
Returns:
true if the internal stored radian is LCD coordinate radian.
See Also:
isStaticInLcd()

setStaticInLcd

public void setStaticInLcd(boolean s)
Set the "static in LCD" property. "static in LCD" means the internal stored radian is the radian in LCD coordinate. It is recommend that set this value true if you want the angle rotate with NXT brick and set this value false if you want the angle looks like just stay there no matter whether the NXT brick is rotated or not. Do so can reduce the burden of the CPU.

Specified by:
setStaticInLcd in class McObject
Parameters:
s - "static in LCD" property.
See Also:
setStaticInLcd(boolean)

add

public McAngle add(McAngle angle)
Just add an angle into this angle. This angle will be changed. The effect of this method invocation would be turn clockwise if staticInLcd is true.

Parameters:
angle -
Returns:
this object itself

addNew

public McAngle addNew(McAngle angle)
The angle of this angle add another angle and return the result as a new McAngle object. This angle won't be changed.

Parameters:
angle -

ltRound

public McAngle ltRound()
Ex.
  • 720 degree -> 0 degree
  • 368 degree -> 8 degree
  • -735 degree -> -15 degree
